com.google.template.soy.pysrc.internal

Class PySrcMain

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.google.template.soy.pysrc.internal.PySrcMain

  • public final class PySrcMain
extends Object
    Main entry point for the Python Src backend (output target).

    Important: Do not use outside of Soy code (treat as superpackage-private).

    • Constructor Summary

public PySrcMain(GuiceSimpleScope apiCallScope,

        apiCallScope - The scope object that manages the API call scope.

    • Method Detail

      • genPySrc

        public List<String> genPySrc(SoyFileSetNode soyTree,
                             SoyPySrcOptions pySrcOptions)
                      throws SoySyntaxException
        Generates Python source code given a Soy parse tree and an options object.
        Parameters:
        soyTree - The Soy parse tree to generate Python source code for.
        pySrcOptions - The compilation options relevant to this backend.
        Returns:
        A list of strings where each string represents the Python source code that belongs in one Python file. The generated Python files correspond one-to-one to the original Soy source files.
        Throws:
        SoySyntaxException - If a syntax error is found.

      • genPyFiles

        public void genPyFiles(SoyFileSetNode soyTree,
                       SoyPySrcOptions pySrcOptions,
                       String outputPathFormat,
                       String inputPathsPrefix)
                throws SoySyntaxException,
                       IOException
        Generates Python source files given a Soy parse tree, an options object, and information on where to put the output files.
        Parameters:
        soyTree - The Soy parse tree to generate Python source code for.
        pySrcOptions - The compilation options relevant to this backend.
        outputPathFormat - The format string defining how to build the output file path corresponding to an input file path.
        inputPathsPrefix - The input path prefix, or empty string if none.
        Throws:
        SoySyntaxException - If a syntax error is found.
        IOException - If there is an error in opening/writing an output Python file.
